0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Relapsing remitting multiple sclerosis: initial, 63 mcg SUBQ on day 1, then 94 mcg SUBQ on day 15, then 125 mcg SUBQ on day 29; continue 125 mcg SUBQ every 14 days thereafter; may premedicate or concurrently use an antipyretic/analgesic for flu-like symptoms

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to natural or recombinant interferon beta or peginterferon, or any product component

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- congestive heart failure, cardiomyopathy, and cardiomyopathy with congestive heart failure have been reported; monitoring recommended in those with preexisting significant cardiac disease
  • Dermatologic:
  • -- injection site reactions, including necrosis, have been reported; avoid injecting near necrotic area or discontinue based on extent of necrosis; discontinue use if multiple lesions occur
  • Hematologic:
  • -- decreased peripheral blood counts, including pancytopenia and severe thrombocytopenia, have been reported; monitoring recommended particularly with myelosuppression
  • Hepatic:
  • -- hepatic injury, including hepatitis, autoimmune hepatitis, and severe hepatic failure, has been reported; monitoring recommended; consider discontinuation if condition occurs
  • -- asymptomatic elevations of hepatic transaminases have been reported with interferon beta; monitoring recommended
  • Immunologic:
  • -- anaphylaxis and serious allergic reactions have been reported with interferon beta; discontinue if condition occurs
  • -- angioedema and urticaria have been reported; discontinue if condition occurs
  • -- autoimmune disorders (eg, idiopathic thrombocytopenia, hyper- and hypothyroidism, autoimmune hepatitis) have been reported; monitoring recommended; discontinue if new autoimmune disorder occurs
  • Neurologic:
  • -- seizures have been reported; additional caution recommended with use in persons with seizure disorders
  • Psychiatric:
  • -- depression, suicidal ideation, and suicide have been reported; consider discontinuation if depression or other severe psychiatric symptoms develop

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Erythema at injection site (62%), Injection site pain (15%), Injection site pruritus (13%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Arthralgia (11%)
  • Neurologic:Asthenia (13%), Headache (44%)
  • Other:Fever (45%), Influenza-like illness (47%), Shivering (17%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Congestive heart failure
  • Dermatologic:Injection site necrosis (Rare)
  • Hematologic:Decreased lymphocyte count (Less than 1%), Decreased platelet count (Less than 1%), Decreased white blood cell count (7%), Neutropenia (Less than 1%), Pancytopenia (Rare), Thrombocytopenia (Rare)
  • Hepatic:Autoimmune hepatitis, Hepatitis, Liver failure
  • Immunologic:Autoimmune disease (Less than 1%)
  • Neurologic:Seizure (Less than 1%)
  • Psychiatric:Suicidal thoughts
  • Other:Angioedema

0.title: US Trade Names
0.mono:
• Plegridy
  • Plegridy Pen
  • Plegridy Starter Pack
  • Plegridy Pen Starter Pack

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: The exact mechanism of action of peginterferon beta-1a in patients with multiple sclerosis is unknown.

0.title: Absorption
0.mono: Tmax, multiple sclerosis, subQ: 1 to 1.5 days

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Subcutaneous
  • allow to warm to room temperature for 30 minutes prior to injection
  • administer by subQ injection
  • may be self-administered

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• reduction in relapse rate and disability progression is indicative of efficacy.
  • liver function tests, during therapy
  • CBC with differential, during therapy, especially in patients with myelosuppression
  • signs and symptoms of liver injury
  • signs and symptoms of cardiac disease progression; at treatment initiation and thereafter in patients with preexisting cardiac disease
  • signs and symptoms of infection, bleeding, and anemia

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Plegridy Pen
    Subcutaneous Solution: 125 MCG/0.5 ML
  • Plegridy
    Subcutaneous Solution: 125 MCG/0.5 ML

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Counsel patient to report symptoms of hepatic dysfunction, congestive heart failure, or cardiomyopathy.
  • Instruct patient to report new or worsening depression or suicidal ideation.
  • Tell patient to immediately report seizures.
  • Direct patient to report any infection, bleeding, or symptoms of anemia.
  • Side effects may include arthralgia, myalgia, asthenia, chills, headache, or pyrexia.
  • Advise patient to report serious injection site reactions (necrosis).
  • Teach patient proper technique and placement of injection.
